cst8284.assignment1

Class TaskManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • cst8284.assignment1.TaskManager

  • public class TaskManager
extends javafx.application.Application
    Manages all ToDo object related actions (i.e create a new ToDo, display information, save, change, delete and sort)
    Author:
    fatema

    • Nested Class Summary

      • showCenterPaneAfterSortButtonClick

        public void showCenterPaneAfterSortButtonClick(int startIndex,
                                               int destIndex)
        This method handles selection event of a title list view item. Once a title selected the center pane changes in order to reflect the corresponding information of that element. This method takes two arguments as index of the element to display. To display the selected element, use the same value (currently displayed index) for both argument.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - current element index
        destIndex - destination element index

      • generateTaskButton

        public javafx.scene.control.Button generateTaskButton()
        Returns a button (Sort by title) and also deals with the mouse click event. It sorts the elements by their titles.
        Returns:
        Button taskBtn

      • generateCenterPaneContent

        public javafx.scene.layout.Pane generateCenterPaneContent(ToDo td)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • showBootomPane

        public void showBootomPane(int currentIndex,
                           int destIndex,
                           boolean dir)
        Displays a ToDo element.
        Parameters:
        currentIndex - current ToDo element index
        destIndex - destination ToDo element index
        dir - true means forward direction, false indicates reverse direction.

      • generateBottomPaneContent

        public javafx.scene.layout.Pane generateBottomPaneContent(ToDo td)
        This method performs the following step: 1) Creates bottom pane. 2) Add four button 3) Associates with action (a mouse click event is implemented for each of the button to load the todo content to the scene by calling generateBottomPaneContent())
        Parameters:
        td - ToDo object
        Returns:
        bottom Pane object.

      • findNextIndex

        public int findNextIndex(int currentIndex,
                         int destIndex,
                         boolean rightDir)
        This method returns the correct index skipping the empty elements and also decide which way it should move (forward or backward).
        Parameters:
        currentIndex - current index of the ToDo element.
        destIndex - destination index
        rightDir - true value indicates forward direction, otherwise backward direction.
        Returns:
        next available index

      • enableDisableButton

        public void enableDisableButton()
        This method enables the buttons based on the fact that whether there are other elements to move to backward or forward. If such move is not possible, it disable the corresponding button.

      • hasValidNext

        private boolean hasValidNext(int currentIndex,
                             boolean rightDir)
        Searches if a valid ToDo (non empty) exist from the current position in either direction (forward or backward).
        Parameters:
        currentIndex - current ToDo object index
        rightDir - : true value indicates forward direction and false value backward direction
        Returns:
        true if next a non empty ToDo found in the given direction

      • activityDetectedCenterPane

        public void activityDetectedCenterPane()

      • handleDirtyToDo

        public void handleDirtyToDo()
        Handles any unsaved changes on ToDo element. If the current ToDo is changed but not saved, it prompts the user to save or discard changes.

      • saveCenterPaneContents2ToDo

        public void saveCenterPaneContents2ToDo()
        Saves user changes in the ToDo object. This method uses the getters just addedâ€”for the Textboxes, Textfield and radiobuttonsâ€” takes their contents and loads them into a temporary ToDo object using the ToDo() constructor. Use this ToDo to replace the existing ToDo in the ArrayList, which will now contain the revised information according to the new contents of the three center pane text objects.

      • isToDoArrayListDirty

        public boolean isToDoArrayListDirty()
        This method is used when (a) about to exit, or (b) about to open a new
        Returns:
        true indicates one of the ToDo element is dirty, false otherwise.

      • displayFileContent

        private void displayFileContent()
        Loads ToDo objects from user selected file.

      • addToDoHandler

        public void addToDoHandler()
        Adds handler for the following cases: 1) allows the user to insert a new (empty) ToDo after the current Todo 2) displays various fields for user input in the center pane. 3) insert a new ToDo into the ArrayList, and load a center pane with empty boxes.

      • removeToDo

        public void removeToDo()
        Remove ToDoâ€¦ deletes the current ToDo element from the ArrayList. prompt the user with a dialog window asking the user to confirm the deletion
